Module org.cojen.tupl
Package org.cojen.tupl

Interface Updater

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable, Flushable, Scanner
public interface Updater extends Scanner, Flushable
Scans through all entries in a view, updating them along the way. Updater implementations which perform pre-fetching can be more efficient than a cursor. Any exception thrown by an updating action automatically closes the Updater.

Updater instances can only be safely used by one thread at a time, and they must be closed when no longer needed. Instances can be exchanged by threads, as long as a happens-before relationship is established. Without proper exclusion, multiple threads interacting with an Updater instance may cause database corruption.

See Also:

  • Field Details

    • NO_UPDATE

      static final byte[] NO_UPDATE
      Empty marker returned by EntryFunction to indicate that no update should be performed.

  • Method Details

    • update

      boolean update(byte[] value) throws IOException
      Update the current value and then step to the next entry. Pass null to delete the entry.
      Returns:
      false if no more entries remain and updater has been closed
      Throws:
      IOException

    • updateAll

      default void updateAll(EntryFunction action) throws IOException
      Applies the given updating action for each remaining entry, and then closes the updater. An entry is updated to the value returned by the action, or it's deleted when the action returns null. If the action returns NO_UPDATE, then no update is performed.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • flush

      default void flush() throws IOException
      Ensures that any queued update operations are applied; flushing is automatically performed when the updater is closed.
      Specified by:
      flush in interface Flushable
      Throws:
      IOException
